intro: Lagetta lagetto, commonly known as the small-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has small, narrow leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, and its stems are often hairy. Lagetta lagetto is often found in alpine or coastal environments, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these unique ecosystems.
